@Rune_Hacker1 wrote:

This is cool, but is there a way to make your original cursor disapear so it looks like the bitmap is your icon. There must be a way to either replace it or something, but idk, maybe not.

item.title: Hmmm.. I Was playing Around with SCAR
item.dc:creator: @wonderguy6 Doc. Booty
item.description:
@wonderguy6 wrote:

Hehe look what i found:

[php]program Changing_Cursor;
var x, y, Icon : integer;
buffer : integer;

procedure CursorToMouse;
Var
W, H, x1, y1 : integer;
begin

DisplayDebugImgWindow(500, 400);
Buffer:= BitmapFromString(500, 400, ‘’);

    SetTransparentColor(Icon ,  clblack);
    If(FindWindowTitlePart('Debug', False))Then
      Begin
            GetClientDimensions(W, H);
            writeln('Successfully complied')
            end;

          repeat
          
          getmousepos(x,y)
          X1:= X - 10;
          y1:= y - 10;
          
          FastDrawSizeTransparent(x1, y1, x1+22, y1+22, Icon, Buffer)

     SafeDrawBitmap(Buffer, GetDebugCanvas, 0, 0);
     FastDrawClear(Buffer, clblack);
     until(false)

end;

procedure loadbitmaps;
begin
Icon := BitmapFromString(32, 32, ‘z78DAED98EB0AC3200’ +
‘C855F293FF77FE0FB3FD23A3A98B31E4DCCA5C27204299BA4DFF1’ +
‘D628512A15A9C751EC6AFAD471CCE5D0593FA95FEA36B8FE75E14’ +
‘B6EC53CF6E2457E1296F27DD6D17A7BB98B5CEF6207728D8B77FB’ +
‘3DC8E52E7A3D2F7D57BDA24BA5717B0B17EDCC1947469C4828827’ +
‘C94D1F742C62F551DEDEADA62145AFE719C357E345EFFC48F6691’ +
‘2FFF7515E8F8D128C4F1F3D79AC72CE2EF3CBA7E96EE42ED28A03’ +
‘7A23D8493D771FE9DFD4E0BDF02AB6C13C5E4144946C175A1E191’ +
‘90AF6744919C163DBF970BDE9CE7FAB863CED89E917DF9BD4E94F’ +
‘3ECAE3D29CB77308F1B893ED5FCF66097FB93F8BB9A542AC5D50B’ +
‘77F22AB7’);
end;

begin
loadbitmaps;
CursorToMouse
end.[/php]

Basicly you can have an image following the cursor therefor making the cursor an image.
Pretty cool if you ask me.

Read full topic
